Description: uper cool Burns Steer from the first run of reissues of the '79 prototype guitar. There's nothing out there quite like this. It plays like a hardtail strat, but gets both tele and LP Junior tones and has a chambered body that allows for semi-acoustic tones. One of kind guitar, for sure!*******************************************NOTE: The original pickups went microphonic, so it is upgraded to a P-90 (GSF Surf 90). So the coil tap isn't wired to anything*******************************************The guitar is in fantastic playing condition-- it does show it's age.. with oxidation and blemishes mostly in the mirrored pick guard. I think it gives the guitar a really nice patina. There is a lot of wear to the Burns hardshell case, but it's a really unique case and is still good enough to be protective. Burns Steer info from internet:The steer was described in the USA guitar magazine as a new guitar with bizarre beauty because of its original design and sound-hole feature-catching the eye immediately.With two body cavities the semi-hollow Steer delivers a wide range of awesome tones.Features include:43mm nut widthBurns deluxe machine headsMaple fingerboard 20 frets, 25.5" lengthBolt on hardrock maple neckBi flex two way type truss rodBurns single coil neck pickupGSF Surf 90 bridge pickupClassic polyester finish on basswood bodyMaster volume, ideally positioned for violiningBurns deluxe bridge unitThree way pickup selector switchTwo seperate tone controlsCoil tap switch Read lessThis item is sold As-DescribedThis item is sold As-Described and cannot be returned unless it arrives in a condition different from how it was described or photographed.Product SpecsCondition: Good (Used)Brand: BurnsModel:SteerFinish:GreenCategories:Semi-Hollow
